snippet: The authors of “Actual Innocence” recoiled at how it was used in a decision on the collection of DNA by police.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column; authors of book Actual Innocence are horrified at how Supreme Court Justice Anthony M Kennedy cited their work in writing majority decision on whether authorities may take DNA samples from people arrested in connection with serious crimes.
lead_paragraph: The authors of “Actual Innocence” recoiled at how it was used in a decision on the collection of DNA by police.

headline.print_headline: Cited by a Justice, but Feeling Less Than Honored
headline.seo: Cited by a Justice, but Feeling Less Than Honored
headline.main: Cited by a Justice, but Feeling Less Than Honored
